Meanwhile, Alexander settled onto the living room sofa.

Evelyn handed him a bowl of fruit. "You must be tired from the long flight. Have some—you need the vitamins."

Alexander usually avoided fruit due to its sweetness, preferring supplements instead.

Yet he took small bites of what Evelyn offered.

Between mouthfuls, he reassured her, "Evelyn, don’t worry about the gossip. Nathaniel will hold those people accountable. Cassandra Blake has already received a lawsuit notice."

"That company is nearly bankrupt, and a buyer is circling. That family will lose everything soon, buried in debt. No one involved will escape consequences."

Evelyn stared at him, bowl in hand. "Alexander."

"If something’s on your mind, just say it," he replied, meeting her gaze.

He’d postponed critical business to handle this personally.

As her eldest brother, shielding her from slander was his duty.

Evelyn took a deliberate bite. "Alexander, how do you know they’ll lose everything? That sounds like insider knowledge."

She understood Nathaniel’s legal pursuit—but the bankruptcy details?

It almost sounded like Alexander was orchestrating the takeover.

His lashes flickered—he’d said too much.

Regaining composure, he shrugged. "Vista Properties is acquiring them. I work there. Hence, the intel."

"What a coincidence," Evelyn murmured, though suspicion prickled.

In her understanding, Victoria’s brother ran that company.

Penelope and Victoria were likely the schemers.

Logically, Victoria would never let her brother sell—it’d be suicide.

Sensing tension, Alexander shifted topics. "Evelyn, where’s Julian? Working late?"

"No. I told him you were coming. He promised to be home early."

The doorbell rang.

"That must be him. Forgot his keys again." She opened the door—and froze.

An unexpected visitor stood there.
###Chapter 197



The second Evelyn recognized the figures at her doorstep, every muscle in her body screamed to slam the door shut.

She hadn’t bothered checking the peephole, assuming it was Julian returning after forgetting his keys—a mistake she now deeply regretted.

"Evelyn Carter, how dare you try to shut us out?" Beverly Simmons barged in without hesitation, her presence an unwelcome intrusion. "We’ve been hunting you down for months. How can you afford this luxury apartment when you’re supposed to be penniless?"

Her voice dripped with accusation. "Liar."

Walter Simmons crossed his arms, his tone sharp. "Let’s make one thing clear, Evelyn. Don’t even think about laying a finger on that demolition payout or the house. Everything belongs to my son. He’s the only rightful heir of this family."

Evelyn’s gaze turned glacial. "That house is Aunt Margaret’s. You have no claim over it."

Beverly scoffed. "She only has a daughter. What use does she have for property and money? My brother is still hospitalized. If you take everything and run off with another man, what happens to him? As his brother, it’s my duty to protect his assets. Otherwise, he’ll wake up to nothing."

"How noble of you," Evelyn replied dryly, seeing right through their scheme.

Their greed for the demolition compensation was painfully transparent.

Just then, Alexander stepped out of the bathroom.

His eyes locked onto her adoptive parents, a dangerous glint in his gaze. "Well, well. Back for more? Was the last lesson not enough? Would you like an encore—this time with guaranteed broken bones?"

Walter paled, instinctively cradling his arm—the one that still ached whenever it rained.

Beverly stumbled back but refused to retreat entirely.

Meanwhile, in the kitchen, Margaret tensed at the commotion. She moved to intervene, but Olivia stopped her with a gentle hand. "Aunt Margaret, let the younger ones handle this. Stay out of sight. Just focus on dinner. We’ll eat when Julian gets back."

Margaret hesitated. "But—shouldn’t I do something?"

Olivia shook her head. "Trust me, it’s better this way. If you step in, it’ll only complicate things. Alexander has it under control."

She wasn’t worried. Not with Alexander there.

Besides, this was his chance to play the protective older brother—something he’d been obsessing over lately.

If she had to hear him mutter about "being a better brother" one more time, she’d lose her mind.

Alexander’s voice cut through the tension. "Get out. If I see you here again, I’ll make sure you never walk properly again."

Beverly shot Evelyn a venomous glare. "This isn’t over, Evelyn Carter! That house is ours, and we will get it!"

Walter opened his mouth to threaten her, but one look from Alexander stole his voice.

They fled without another word.



The taste of defeat was bitter.

They had come to make a scene, to intimidate Evelyn into submission—but they hadn’t expected Alexander to be there.

Instead of causing chaos, they had scurried away like frightened mice.

Alexander’s presence alone was enough to send them running.

He had assumed they’d learned their lesson after the last encounter.

Clearly, he’d overestimated their intelligence.
###Chapter 198

No matter what, Beverly and Walter were Evelyn's adoptive parents. Even though they treated her horribly, Margaret, their sister-in-law, had taken Evelyn in, offering a ray of hope.

Nathaniel was still grateful that the Simmonses had raised Evelyn.

But their greed was beyond anything he had anticipated.

To think they would show up at Evelyn's doorstep to threaten her? Unacceptable.

Evelyn shut the door and sank onto the couch. "I knew this would happen the moment the demolition was announced. They'd definitely come for that house."

Even blood relatives would fight over money, let alone adoptive parents.

Nathaniel's voice was firm. "Don't worry, Evelyn. I'll handle this."

It would take him nothing more than a single call to deal with people like them.

Margaret emerged from the kitchen, her face lined with worry. "Evelyn, they won't stop here. They'll keep coming back. How did they even find this place? I swear I didn’t tell anyone."

"I have a hunch about how they found us. It doesn’t matter now. Just don’t give in, no matter what."

Evelyn was certain Penelope had given them the address.

Penelope was also the reason they had tracked her down at the studio.

Nathaniel reassured the distraught Margaret. "Aunt Margaret, don’t worry. Leave it to me."

"You don’t understand how shameless they are, Nathaniel. I can handle it, but I don’t want Evelyn hurt. She’s still so young. She has her whole life ahead of her." Tears spilled down Margaret’s cheeks.

Normally composed, Margaret only broke down when pushed to her limits.

Olivia guided Margaret to the bedroom to comfort her, then shot Nathaniel a meaningful glance.

He knew exactly what needed to be done. Pulling out his phone, he sent a quick message to his assistant: Look into the demolition case.

The first step was identifying the company behind the demolition. Nathaniel already had a plan forming.

The old Nathaniel might have resorted to extreme measures—like having Beverly and Walter disappear permanently. But now, reformed, he would teach them a lesson the right way.

He met Evelyn’s gaze, his voice steady. "Don’t worry. We’ll stand by you until this is over."

"But it’ll take so much time."

"We’ll take turns keeping you company." Just then, Julian walked in.

Olivia had already updated the group chat about Beverly and Walter’s unexpected visit—and their demands.
###Chapter 199

Evelyn carefully arranged the silverware on the dining table before gently persuading Margaret to join them for dinner.

Tears welled up in Margaret's eyes as she confessed, "Look at me. I completely panicked when trouble came knocking. My late husband was such a strict man too. If not for Evelyn's quick thinking, we would've been at those villains' mercy."

Alexander felt a sharp pang of guilt twist in his chest.

If only the Montgomery family hadn't lost Evelyn all those years ago, she wouldn't have needed to develop such survival instincts.

After witnessing Beverly and Walter's outrageous behavior firsthand, he couldn't begin to imagine the hardships Evelyn must have endured growing up with them.

This only strengthened his resolve to deal with Victoria once and for all and bring Evelyn back where she belonged.

As dinner concluded, Alexander, Olivia, and Evelyn huddled together to discuss strategies for handling the demolition situation.

To Alexander, the entire conversation seemed unnecessary - he could have simply delegated the matter to his team with a single phone call.

What the others didn't see were the subtle kicks Olivia kept delivering to his shins beneath the table, forcing him to maintain the charade.

They couldn't risk breaking character now. While they could handle everything discreetly later, they needed to keep up appearances in front of Evelyn.

A sudden yawn escaped Evelyn's lips as exhaustion washed over her.

Lately, sleep seemed to claim her at the most unexpected moments. Though morning sickness hadn't plagued her, her body demanded increasingly longer hours of rest.

Julian noticed her drooping eyelids immediately. "Alexander, Olivia, it's getting late. Let's call it a night. The demolition issue can wait until tomorrow."

The trio departed with minimal farewells.

The moment the elevator doors closed, Alexander declared, "I've already put investigators on the demolition company. There's no way I'll let Evelyn's so-called parents profit from this. She's suffered enough because of them."

Olivia tapped her chin thoughtfully. "Evelyn's current place only has two bedrooms. It's rather cramped. Perhaps we could use this opportunity to get her better accommodations?"

His eyes lit up with sudden inspiration. "Exactly! What about that villa I own near her university? It would be perfect."

Julian stroked his jawline skeptically. "Isn't a villa a bit excessive? With so many families involved in this demolition, if Evelyn suddenly receives a mansion, it will raise too many questions."

Alexander exhaled sharply. "Why must we keep hiding our identities? I truly believe Evelyn has accepted us by now."

He owned numerous luxury properties across the city - each one he longed to place in Evelyn's name.

Julian considered this carefully. "Let's settle things with Victoria first. Then we'll make our move."

They couldn't possibly welcome Evelyn back into the Montgomery family with Victoria still lurking in the shadows.

Besides, Julian was certain someone as manipulative as Victoria wouldn't remain part of their family for long.

Meanwhile, Evelyn avoided work entirely, dividing her time between lectures and the university library to steer clear of Beverly and Walter.

With Alexander constantly by her side, the Simmons couple might think twice before showing up unannounced.

All Evelyn needed to do was hold out until Margaret signed the demolition papers. After that, her adoptive parents would lose all leverage.

Jonathan reached out to her later that evening. "Evelyn, things have quieted down at work. You could come back anytime."

"But I'd prefer to wait until after the demolition is settled."

"Evelyn, don't tell me you're planning to quit once you get that compensation money," Jonathan teased lightly.

Evelyn laughed softly. "With all my debts? I'll hardly be rich after this."
###Chapter 200

"Evelyn, the client specifically requested you to lead the Mael Neighborhood Project."

"They adore your impeccable taste and attention to detail."

"Understood. I'll head to the studio now." Evelyn ended the call, adjusting her face mask nervously.

She couldn't risk being recognized by her adoptive parents.

Jonathan raised an eyebrow at her disguise. "Undercover mission, Ms. Carter?"

"Just being cautious. Email me the project updates later. I'll review everything thoroughly."

No sooner had she settled at her workstation than the studio doors burst open violently.

"Evelyn Carter!"

The shrill voice made Evelyn's head snap up.

Cassandra Blake stood there, a far cry from her usual polished self.

Her designer clothes were replaced by wrinkled garments, her hair unkempt as if she hadn't showered in days.

Evelyn set aside her sketches. "Can I help you with something?"

Jonathan immediately stepped between them. "Ms. Blake, you were terminated. Any trouble here won't be tolerated."

Cassandra's face twisted with rage. "How could you do this, Jonathan? What about your promises that night? You swore you'd take responsibility!"

A shadow crossed his face before he calmly replied, "I never made such promises."

"You liar! We slept together!" she screamed.

"Everyone knows the truth, Cassandra," he snapped. "You framed Evelyn. You brought this on yourself."

Had he known she was a gold digger, he would never have touched her. He'd even gotten tested afterward.

Suddenly, Cassandra collapsed to her knees before Evelyn, tears streaming. "I was wrong! Please forgive me!"

Evelyn blinked in shock. The confrontation had taken an unexpected turn.

She glanced around suspiciously, half-expecting hidden cameras.

With Penelope's influence, Evelyn knew to proceed carefully.

The Blake family's company had declared bankruptcy, leaving them drowning in debt.

Penelope had ghosted Cassandra completely, blocking all contact.

To make matters worse, Cassandra had received legal threats - apologize to Evelyn or face prison.

Forced into submission, she now groveled at Evelyn's feet.

Rage burned inside Cassandra. How did Evelyn always come out on top? The Fleur International Design Competition. Jonathan's favor.

They were equally talented! Why did Evelyn get everything?

Meanwhile, Jonathan watched thoughtfully. Perhaps Evelyn had powerful connections.

Still processing the bizarre scene, Evelyn reached out. "What are you-"

Without warning, Cassandra lunged at her.
###Chapter 201



Cassandra lunged at Evelyn with terrifying speed, her manicured nails aimed straight for the abdomen.

Evelyn's body moved before her mind could process, arms crossing protectively over her stomach.

Jonathan reacted with lightning reflexes, shoving Cassandra aside with enough force to send her stumbling. "Have you lost your damn mind?" he roared.

Cassandra's laughter was shrill and unhinged, her gaze locked on Evelyn's guarded posture. "I know your dirty little secret, Evelyn Carter. That belly you're so desperate to protect."

The realization hit Evelyn like ice water - Cassandra had been watching her too closely these past weeks.

Every passing moment only fueled Cassandra's growing resentment.

While her own career floundered, Evelyn soared as lead designer under Jonathan's mentorship.

The jealousy had festered until Cassandra could no longer contain it.

Evelyn's face drained of color, her pulse hammering against her ribs.

That could have ended catastrophically.

Without Jonathan's intervention... She didn't dare finish the thought.

Stepping forward, Evelyn delivered a stinging slap across Cassandra's cheek. "You've crossed a line you can't uncross," she said, voice dangerously calm.

No one threatened her child and walked away unscathed.

Cassandra's grin turned predatory. "You're pregnant, aren't you? That's why you're so protective."

Evelyn's mask slipped for only a heartbeat before her lips curled in derision. "Maybe you should get your delusions checked by a psychiatrist."

"Then why shield your stomach?" Cassandra challenged.

Evelyn arched one perfect eyebrow. "Basic self-preservation. Should I have let you claw my face instead?"

The pregnancy remained her most guarded secret.

Until the divorce was finalized, no one could know about the life growing inside her.

Yet somehow this venomous woman had sniffed out the truth.

Cassandra's attention snapped to Jonathan. "See how she lies? She's some rich bastard's mistress carrying his bastard child while deceiving you!"

Evelyn scoffed. "Your fantasies are truly pathetic. There's nothing between Jonathan and me."

Jonathan's expression darkened. "Security. Now."

Cassandra scrambled to her feet, rage twisting her features. "Why does everything always go your way?" she shrieked.

Evelyn remained impassive. "You made your choices. I didn't force you into anyone's bed."

The security team arrived swiftly, dragging the thrashing woman away as she hurled obscenities.

Outside, Cassandra fumbled for her phone, fingers trembling with fury.

Penelope didn't answer.

She fired off a Twitter DM: 'Evelyn Carter is pregnant.'

The response came within minutes. "Is this true?" Penelope demanded.

"Swear on my life," Cassandra typed back.

"Proof or it didn't happen." Penelope had learned not to trust Cassandra's word after the credit card fiasco.

Some lessons came at great cost.
###Chapter 202

"Evelyn instinctively protected her abdomen when I lunged at her. Her reaction was too visceral. I've had my suspicions for months, but today confirmed everything."

"Why should I trust you? Your last scheme backfired spectacularly. My entire family reprimanded me because of your ridiculous rumors!"

Bitterness twisted Cassandra's features as she thought, "Of course. Penelope gets away with everything because she's a Whitmore, while I bear all the consequences. No one ever listens to my side."

Her voice turned glacial. "Evelyn has protection - that famous actor Daniel Montgomery. I'd bet my last dollar he's the father."

Penelope tapped her manicured nails thoughtfully. "You might be onto something."

Daniel's interference had ruined Penelope's plans to humiliate Evelyn publicly. The memory still rankled.

She examined her fresh French tips. "But accusations require proof. Get me concrete evidence of Evelyn's pregnancy, and we'll talk."

"I'll manage it. Though Ms. Whitmore, you're aware of my current... predicament." Cassandra's jaw tightened. "Jobless, reputation in tatters. I require financial assistance."

Penelope's eye roll was theatrical. "I'll transfer two thousand dors. Bring me proof, and you'll get proper compensation."

The notification chimed. Cassandra's fingers clenched around her phone. This paltry sum wouldn't have covered her monthly spa treatments before. Penelope was mocking her.

Yet desperation won over pride.

As she left, Cassandra cast one last venomous look at the studio building. Evelyn and Penelope would both pay for this humiliation.

Meanwhile, Evelyn slumped in her chair, pulse hammering violently. The confrontation had left her shaken.

Jonathan approached with a steaming mug. "Drink this. You're white as a sheet."

"Thanks... for earlier." The chamomile tea steadied her hands slightly, but did nothing for the nausea rising in her throat.

Suddenly the room tilted. She gripped the desk. "Jonathan—"

"Evelyn!"

Her knees buckled before she could respond.

Jonathan caught her effortlessly. "I've got you. Hospital. Now."

Through gritted teeth, Evelyn gasped, "St. Mary's." Julian would ensure discretion there.

During the frantic drive, Jonathan kept murmuring reassurances while Evelyn fought to stay conscious. With trembling fingers, she dialed her brother.

Julian answered on the first ring. "Evie? What's—"

"Stomach... pain... St. Mary's..." Each word cost her.

"Don't move! I'm coming!"

Relief flooded her. Julian would handle everything. No one could discover her condition.

As Jonathan carried her through the emergency entrance, Nathaniel and Victoria emerged from a parked Mercedes.

Victoria was mid-sentence when Nathaniel froze. "—and the surgical team prepared— Nathaniel? What—"

Her gaze followed his.

Evelyn's unconscious form was disappearing through the automatic doors in another man's arms.
###Chapter 203

A tense silence fell between them.

Evelyn never imagined she would run into Victoria at the hospital.

Evelyn quickly whispered, "Nathaniel, that woman in that man's arms looks just like Victoria. Am I hallucinating?"

Nathaniel's lips thinned. She might be right. It was Victoria.

Irritated, he stormed into the hospital without another word.

Evelyn hurried after him. "Nathaniel, why don't we go ask them? It might be Victoria. We should check on her. Even though you're divorced now, for old times' sake—"

"Enough!" He stopped abruptly, his jaw clenched. The sight of another man carrying Victoria into the emergency room had set him off. "Where's your brother?"

"He's on the third floor. I can take you to him." A faint smirk played on Evelyn's lips. She knew exactly how to twist the knife.

If she framed it like this, Nathaniel wouldn’t spare another thought for Victoria.

From the way that man had cradled Victoria in his arms, Evelyn could tell there was something between them.

And Nathaniel? As a man, how could he possibly tolerate that?

They stepped into the elevator just as Julian rushed down the stairs.

Julian headed straight for the emergency room.

A man stood beside Victoria, explaining urgently to the nurse and doctor, "She collapsed suddenly. It might be low blood sugar or extreme shock."

Julian narrowed his eyes and strode forward. "I know this patient's condition. Everyone else, step out."

Hearing his voice, Victoria finally relaxed. With Julian here, she knew she was safe.

Still, Jonathan hesitated. He gave her one last worried glance. "Victoria, I'll wait outside. Don't be afraid."

Julian studied him with a sharp gaze. Her admirer? Not bad—handsome and attentive. But he hasn’t earned my approval yet. Not just anyone gets to be my sister’s man.

Inside the emergency room, Julian examined Victoria. Knowing she was pregnant, he already had an idea of what had happened.

Half an hour later, Victoria finally stirred.

Her eyelids fluttered open. Seeing Julian beside her, she exhaled in relief. "Julian."

"Victoria, you're awake. Any discomfort?"

"Just dizzy. Everything went black, and I felt cold before I passed out. Am I sick? Is the baby okay?" Her hand instinctively cradled her stomach.

The baby’s safety was her biggest concern.

Julian hesitated for a moment. "The baby is fine—strong and healthy. But you—you're malnourished and under too much stress. That’s why you fainted."

He sat beside her, debating his next words. "Victoria, I know you might not want to hear this, but your pregnancy is becoming obvious. You can’t hide it forever."

As her brother, he felt he had the right to know—who was the father?

Maybe, just maybe, his position would finally get her to talk.
###Chapter 204

Evelyn hesitated for a moment. "Julian, I don’t want anyone to know I’m pregnant—at least not until I’m officially divorced from Nathaniel."

Julian frowned, unable to comprehend her reasoning. "Why? Is the baby’s father going to cause trouble for you?"

She shook her head, her eyes pleading. "Just keep this between us, please."

Those wide, vulnerable eyes of hers were impossible to resist.

Julian caved in less than three minutes.

As her older brother, he couldn’t deny her this.

Years of guilt weighed on him. Evelyn rarely asked for anything, so how could he refuse?

His pride as her guardian? Irrelevant compared to her well-being.

He ruffled her hair gently. "Fine, I’ll keep your secret. But you have to promise me you’ll take care of yourself. If you feel unwell, you tell me immediately."

"I promise! That’s why I called you right away," Evelyn assured him.

Julian was the only one she trusted enough to insist on coming to Peace Hospital.

He arched a brow. "Speaking of which, who’s the guy who brought you here? An admirer? Not bad-looking, I’ll give him that."

She coughed. "You’re way off, Julian. That’s Jonathan Reeves—my boss and mentor."

"Ah, your boss." Julian assessed him with a critical eye. "Ambitious, I suppose. Potential, but nothing more."

In his opinion, Jonathan wasn’t nearly good enough for her.

Evelyn was extraordinary. No ordinary man could ever measure up.

If Jonathan was just running some small studio, Julian doubted his net worth was impressive. He mentally questioned the studio’s credibility.

Evelyn sighed. "Stop it, Julian."

His phone buzzed incessantly, but he ignored it.

Just then, Jonathan walked in. "Evelyn, you’re awake. How are you feeling?"

"Much better, thanks to you," she replied gratefully.

"Don’t mention it. You really scared me. Glad you’re okay."

Jonathan suddenly noticed the doctor’s icy glare.

Evelyn tugged Julian’s sleeve. "Julian."

Only then did he reluctantly look away. "Relax. I’m not going to eat him."

Jonathan blinked in surprise. "You’re her brother?"

He’d heard Evelyn was an orphan who had recently found her family.

The fact that her brother was a doctor intrigued him.

She nodded. "Yes, this is my third brother, Dr. Julian Montgomery."

Jonathan extended a hand eagerly. "Nice to meet you. I’m Jonathan Reeves."

Julian shook it with minimal enthusiasm. "Don’t try to charm me. You’re her boss, right? She collapsed from overwork. Lighten her workload—without cutting her pay."

"Julian!" Evelyn scolded, embarrassed by his bluntness.

Before he could respond, a nurse entered. "Dr. Montgomery, your sister is waiting for you in your office."
###Chapter 205

Julian stiffened the moment the nurse spoke.

His secret was about to be uncovered.

Evelyn studied him with suspicion. "Sister?"

Did he have another sister she didn’t know about?

He rushed to clarify, "Evelyn, you're my only sister. I swear!"

Never in his life had he acknowledged Victoria as family.

His nervous reaction amused Evelyn. "I didn’t even accuse you of anything, Julian. Why so defensive?"

It was like watching a guilty boyfriend caught red-handed.

He cleared his throat awkwardly. "Just wanted to make things clear."

Turning to the nurse, he said, "Got it. I'll leave shortly."

The nurse hesitated, recognizing the visitor’s identity.

Today, Julian was supposed to meet Nathaniel to discuss the surgical plan for Eleanor.

But Evelyn’s sudden trip to the emergency room changed everything. Her health came first.

"You should go," Jonathan reassured him. "I’ll stay with her."

Julian nodded. "Rest well, Evelyn. We’ll go home together later."

With that, he took the elevator back to his office.

When he pushed the door open, Victoria and Nathaniel were waiting. His expression remained unreadable.

Victoria brightened instantly. "Julian, I called you so many times. Were you busy?"

"Yes. There was an emergency."

Her eyes gleamed. "Was the patient a woman?"

If she wasn’t mistaken, Evelyn had been rushed to the ER.

Nathaniel’s gaze sharpened, locking onto Julian, waiting for confirmation.

If it was Evelyn, he needed to know how she was doing.

Julian’s eyes flickered between them before settling on Nathaniel.

Memories of Nathaniel bringing Evelyn to the hospital resurfaced, and he answered coldly, "No."

He would never admit the truth—not if it meant keeping Nathaniel away from Evelyn forever.

Victoria suppressed a sigh. A missed opportunity. If Evelyn had been the patient, she could’ve twisted the situation to ruin her reputation further.

Nathaniel’s gaze darkened before he redirected the conversation. "Let’s focus on the matter at hand."

He had come personally to discuss Eleanor’s surgery.

Julian took his seat. "You didn’t need to come. The surgical plan requires discussion with the medical team. It’s not something we can finalize now—especially since you’re not a doctor, Mr. Whitmore."

Victoria paled. "Julian, Nathaniel is just concerned about his grandmother."

Nathaniel shot her a chilling look, and she shrank back, sweat forming on her brow.

She had lied to him, claiming the surgical plan was ready just to bring him here.

She hadn’t expected Julian to expose her so bluntly.

Julian noticed her guilt immediately.

Deliberately, he asked, "Victoria, did you mislead Mr. Whitmore?"

Her mind raced for an excuse. "I thought it would help if you two discussed it directly. For Mrs. Whitmore’s sake."

Her back was soaked with sweat.

If Julian revealed the truth, would Nathaniel call off their engagement?
###Chapter 206

Victoria's hands trembled as she faced Nathaniel. "Nathaniel, I'm considering the long-term benefits. It's crucial for everyone to understand the surgical details."

"What purpose would that serve? He's not a medical professional," Julian countered, his calculated words pushing her to the brink.

Her forced smile wavered dangerously.

Nathaniel rose abruptly, barely containing his fury. "We'll discuss this after Dr. Montgomery consults with the specialists."

With that, he strode out, his movements sharp with suppressed anger.

Victoria reached for him, but he brushed her off without hesitation. His eyes held none of their usual warmth.

Left standing alone, she turned to Julian, frustration simmering. "Was that really necessary?"

"I merely stated facts," Julian replied coolly. "You've been so eager to marry him, I assumed your relationship was solid. But from what I just witnessed? He doesn't care for you."

"Julian, Nathaniel and I are engaged," Victoria snapped. "He loves me. He's just upset about my oversight."

Julian's gaze sharpened. "Is that so? Or did he only agree to this engagement after you promised to arrange his grandmother's surgery?"

Her face paled. "That's absurd! We've been together three years. If not for that accident, I'd already be his wife." She drew a shaky breath. "You've never approved of me, but don't interfere with my happiness."

"If you're so convinced this is happiness, proceed," Julian growled. "Victoria, while I've never liked you, I opposed this match because he's wrong for you. That was my only motive."

Despite her being adopted, he couldn't ignore his conscience.

She laughed bitterly. "For my sake? Then prove it—stop lecturing me and focus on perfecting Mrs. Whitmore's surgery."

Storming out, one thought burned in her mind—she wasn't a Montgomery by blood, but she'd carve her own destiny.

In this world, only power guaranteed happiness.

Jonathan stood in the hospital billing queue when a man in a tailored black suit nearly collided with him.

Glancing up, Jonathan met piercing eyes that sent an involuntary chill through him.

Nathaniel Whitmore towered over him, his presence commanding the space between them.

Recognition flickered in Nathaniel's gaze—this was the man who'd brought Evelyn to the hospital.

His jaw tightened as he noted the bills in Jonathan's hand. "Settling medical fees?" Nathaniel's tone was glacial.

"Y-yes," Jonathan stammered, unnerved by the intensity radiating from the other man.

Nathaniel's brow furrowed. "Is the patient recovering well?"

Jonathan hesitated. Does he know Evelyn?

Nathaniel's impatience flared. "I asked you a question."

"The patient is stable," Jonathan answered cautiously. "Sir, are you here for a consultation?"

Something felt off. Nathaniel's demeanor was too authoritative, his face oddly familiar.

Then it clicked.

Jonathan's eyes widened. "You're Nathaniel Whitmore—CEO of Whitmore Group?"
###Chapter 207

Nathaniel Whitmore's gaze sharpened as he hadn't anticipated being recognized.

He responded coolly. "Yes."

Jonathan Reeves was instantly electrified. "What an honor to meet you, Mr. Whitmore! I own Elite Studio. We crossed paths briefly at the Fleur International Design Competition. Truly a privilege."

Nathaniel arched a brow. Years of dealing with ambitious men like Jonathan had honed his ability to read their motives effortlessly.

His eyes flicked to the hospital bill in Jonathan's hand. "What's your connection to the patient?"

Jonathan answered eagerly, "She's my employee. Collapsed suddenly, so I rushed her here."

"Do you routinely push your staff to exhaustion?" Nathaniel's tone carried disapproval.

"Not at all! Hiring Evelyn was a godsend. She's exceptional. Mr. Whitmore, you saw her win first place at Fleur yourself."

Nathaniel's eyes darkened. He pressed further. "Ah, now I recall. What exactly is your relationship with her?"

Jonathan hesitated, caught off guard by the personal inquiry.

Clearing his throat, he replied, "Let's just say... she might soon be my girlfriend. Things are progressing nicely."

The air turned glacial. Nathaniel's expression hardened, making Jonathan instantly regret his words.

Though Nathaniel schooled his features quickly, his stormy eyes betrayed him.

He hadn't expected Evelyn to move on so swiftly with another man.

Just then, Jonathan produced a business card. "My card, Mr. Whitmore. I'd be thrilled to collaborate someday."

Nathaniel studied it before accepting. "Perhaps there will be opportunities."

"Really? That's fantastic! I won't disappoint you, sir!" Jonathan nearly vibrated with excitement.

A partnership with Whitmore Industries could skyrocket Elite Studio to unimaginable heights!

Watching the naked ambition in Jonathan's eyes, Nathaniel pocketed the card and glanced toward the ER doors.

Then he turned on his heel and strode away.

Jonathan remained, watching the retreating figure with dollar signs in his eyes. "Is this my golden ticket?"

Moments later, Victoria Sinclair stepped off the elevator, scanning the hallway for Nathaniel.

Jonathan approached smoothly. "Looking for Mr. Whitmore?"

###Chapter 218

And she’d played it perfectly.

Once her task was done, she wiped the anonymous account clean and disposed of the flash drive. No traces left behind.

Nathaniel had given her that drive. After all, he’d tracked down IP addresses when she’d been targeted online before.

She’d asked him how to stay untraceable, and he’d handed her the drive without question, assuming she had a target in mind. The software inside would reroute any snoopers to a fake IP.

She hadn’t expected to use it so soon. Still, the thrill of deception sent a rush through her veins.

This time, Penelope would regret everything.

Evelyn would make sure she never dared touch her again.

As she finished, she noticed a refund notification—$100,000 returned. Had Nathaniel rejected the transfer?

Back when Beatrice had written that check to Walter and Beverly at their marital home, Evelyn had been furious. The last thing she wanted was to owe the Whitmores a single cent. So she’d sent the exact amount back to Nathaniel.

Why hadn’t he taken it?

She added him again, surprised when the request was instantly accepted.

Had he never blocked her?

She remembered his scolding call when she’d blocked him before. Yet here he was, leaving the door open.

She resent the money.

Would he refuse again? To him, $100,000 was pocket change.

She typed, "Take the payment."

Then she yawned, exhaustion pulling her under.

The next morning, her phone buzzed with a flood of missed calls.

She sat up and checked the headlines.

No surprise—Penelope’s name was everywhere.

"Whitmore Heiress Caught in Drug-Fueled Scandal!"

The story had exploded. Impossible to contain.

A smirk curled Evelyn’s lips.

Then, Penelope called again. This time, Evelyn answered.

"Good morning, Ms. Whitmore."

"Evelyn! Was this you? You’re the only one who knew!" Penelope’s shriek nearly shattered her eardrums.

Evelyn held the phone away, voice dripping with indifference. "I have no idea what you’re talking about."

"Stop lying! You think you can mess with me? I’m a Whitmore. My family will destroy you. Just wait—I’ll ruin you!"

Evelyn’s voice turned to ice. "I warned you. Cross me again, and you’ll regret it."

"You’re nothing! A nobody from the slums! Crushing you is like stepping on an ant. How dare you ambush me? I’ll make sure your whole family pays!"

Evelyn laughed.

"Go ahead. But if you push me, I’ve got another video. One where you’re completely naked. I’m sure the internet would love that."

Silence.

Then—click.

The line went dead.
###Chapter 219

Evelyn's piercing gaze remained fixed on her phone.

"Evelyn, you conniving witch! I asked you repeatedly if you'd deleted all the videos, and you swore you had! Yet here you are, still holding onto your dirty little secret!"

"Of course I kept one," Evelyn replied coolly. "If you and your mother had treated me with even a shred of respect instead of ordering me around like a servant, I wouldn’t have needed insurance. Though, honestly, watching it makes me sick."

Penelope shrieked, her voice cracking with rage. "You vile creature! How dare you call me disgusting?"

"You, without a doubt. Or have you forgotten how quickly you stripped and threw yourself at those men the second the drugs hit?"

Evelyn’s words were deliberate, designed to provoke. Through the phone, she could hear the crash of objects hitting the floor, followed by Penelope’s incoherent screaming.

A smirk curled Evelyn’s lips. "Instead of wasting time yelling at me, maybe invest in a better PR team to clean up your mess."

Then, a new notification flashed on her screen.

Nathaniel.

Her breath hitched as she read his single-word reply:

?

What was that supposed to mean?

"Do you really think a hundred thousand dollars is enough?"

Her pulse spiked. "Shouldn’t it be?"

She retreated to her bedroom, suspicion flaring. Was he trying to backtrack?

"The video you leaked just cost my company millions in stock value. So no, Evelyn, it’s not enough."

"How is that my problem? Blame Penelope. She’s the one who couldn’t keep her clothes on."

Nathaniel’s tone turned glacial. "Hand it over."

He didn’t care about Penelope’s reputation—but he would protect his company.

###Chapter 220

Julian Montgomery. Victoria's brother.

###Chapter 221

Unease kept him quiet. Pushing further might backfire.

Evelyn, too, was relieved when Julian dropped it. More questions would’ve meant more lies.

Her gaze flicked to his buzzing phone. "Julian, your phone won’t stop ringing. Aren’t you going to answer?"

He knew exactly who it was. "Probably the hospital. Nothing urgent. I told them I’d be late."
###Chapter 228



Evelyn gave a slight nod, and an unspoken agreement passed between them to drop the previous subject.

The view outside the window captured her attention - the wedding venue she had painstakingly designed now stood as a cruel irony of fate.

Tomorrow would mark Nathaniel and Victoria's engagement.

A bitter smile touched Evelyn's lips as she lowered her gaze.

She had known this day would come, yet its arrival left a hollow ache in her chest that surprised even her.

As Julian parked at the hospital entrance, he turned to her. "Wait here, Evelyn. I won't be long."

"No need, Julian. I should get back to the studio. Let's have an early dinner tonight though."

His concerned eyes studied her. "Don't overwork yourself," he cautioned.

Watching Julian enter Peace Hospital, Evelyn flagged down a cab and directed it toward the private medical center.

An inexplicable urge pulled her toward Eleanor's room.

With Nathaniel and Victoria's engagement this week and Eleanor's surgery scheduled for the next, at least Victoria's capable brothers could ensure Eleanor received proper care.

That small comfort was all Evelyn could cling to now.

Flowers in hand, Evelyn entered to find Eleanor absorbed in a book. "Grandmother," she greeted softly.

"Evelyn darling!" Eleanor's face lit up. "Come sit. It's been too long - has work been keeping you away?"

Evelyn's lashes fluttered downward. "The studio's been hectic, and my university courses aren't helping matters."

"Don't exhaust yourself, dear. With Nathaniel providing so well, you needn't carry such burdens. Especially now..." Eleanor's meaningful glance dropped to Evelyn's midsection.

Swallowing the lump in her throat, Evelyn forced a smile. "I'll be careful. How have you been feeling? Any discomfort?"

"Never better. It's your condition that worries me. Promise me you'll stop working at the studio when your second trimester begins."

Evelyn's hand instinctively cradled her stomach. "I promise."

Once her pregnancy became impossible to conceal, she planned to return to Nord City with her brothers.



There, far from Nathaniel's reach, she would bring her child into the world.

By then, Nathaniel and Victoria would be married, their lives too entangled to spare thoughts for Evelyn.

Their conversation flowed gently until the door swung open, bringing with it a draft of cool air.

Evelyn turned - and froze. Nathaniel's sudden appearance stole her breath.

Eleanor beamed. "Nathaniel! Here to collect your wife?"

Evelyn averted her gaze, but not before noticing the shoes Nathaniel wore - the custom-made pair she had selected for him years ago.

Simple, unbranded, yet crafted for comfort.

He'd worn them once, then never again. Evelyn had assumed their lack of status symbolism displeased him.

Yet here they were, gracing his feet once more.

Nathaniel's unpredictability confused her more each day.

He moved to stand beside her, his voice calm. "How are you today, Grandmother?"

"Wonderful now that I see you both. Nathaniel, no matter how busy, you must take care of Evelyn. She's carrying precious cargo!"

With that, Eleanor gathered their hands, pressing them together between her own.
###Chapter 229

Evelyn felt Nathaniel's fingers tighten around hers, sending an uncomfortable prickle down her spine.

She tried to subtly pull away, but Eleanor held their joined hands with surprising strength.

"If anything happens to me during this procedure," Eleanor murmured, her voice frail but resolute, "I need you both to look after each other."

Her gaze shifted between them, heavy with unspoken meaning. "With a child on the way, life won't be the same as before."

Evelyn's chest tightened. "Grandmother, you'll be fine. You have to see your great-grandchild born."

Eleanor's lips curved into a serene smile. "Yes, I will see this baby with my own eyes."

A lump formed in Evelyn's throat. Everyone believed her pregnancy was a ruse to convince Eleanor to undergo surgery—only she knew the truth.

Nathaniel's voice, low and steady, cut through her thoughts. "Grandmother, I'll take care of Evelyn and our child. You have nothing to worry about."

Evelyn nearly scoffed.

Wasn't he supposed to be engaged to Victoria tomorrow?

His words were nothing but hollow reassurance.

Eleanor glanced at the clock. "It's getting late. You two should go have dinner."

She waved a dismissive hand. "Hospital food is dreadful. No need to suffer through it with me."

Relief washed over Evelyn. If Eleanor had insisted they stay, she would've struggled to explain why she couldn't—her six brothers were waiting for her at home.

The moment Eleanor released her hand, Evelyn tried to pull away, but Nathaniel's grip remained firm.

Her jaw clenched, but she kept her expression neutral.

Nathaniel's eyes darkened. "I heard the demolition of your old neighborhood was finalized today."

Evelyn arched a brow. "Yes, Penelope went to great lengths for revenge."

A smirk played on her lips. "Though Optima Construction went bankrupt, it didn't stop my family from receiving compensation."

Nathaniel's mouth thinned. "You have quite the network. Always someone ready to help you."

Earlier, he'd seen Julian embracing Evelyn, their closeness undeniable. And during their last call, Julian's voice had been unmistakable in the background.

Wasn't she involved with Harrison?

Now another man?

Evelyn tilted her head, studying his tense grip. "Mr. Whitmore, are you... jealous?"

His expression stiffened.

He released her abruptly. "Don't flatter yourself. I'm just warning you—playing with multiple men is dangerous."

His voice turned icy. "Eventually, it'll blow up in your face. When they find out, you'll regret it."

Evelyn crossed her arms. "That's my business, not yours."

Nathaniel's gaze hardened. "Remember, our divorce isn't finalized yet."

He stepped closer, his voice a low warning. "After Grandmother's surgery next Monday, the one-month waiting period ends. Be on time."

Evelyn met his stare without flinching. "I'll be there."

Nathaniel exhaled sharply, frustration flickering in his eyes. "And don't say anything before the surgery."

Evelyn laughed humorlessly. "You're getting engaged to another woman tomorrow, yet you have the nerve to tell me to keep quiet?"

Her voice dropped to a whisper. "Do you think I enjoy being labeled the 'cheated-on wife'?"

She remembered Nathaniel and Victoria's engagement announcement—the opulence, the whispers, the way the elite circled like vultures.

When she had married Nathaniel, she'd signed a prenuptial agreement under Beatrice's glare, stripped of any claim to the Whitmore fortune.

Now, history was repeating itself.
###Chapter 230

People were truly worlds apart.

Nathaniel yanked at his tie in frustration. "Actually, my engagement with Victoria is—"

"Save it, Mr. Whitmore!" Evelyn cut him off sharply. "Someone like me has no right to question you, let alone listen to your explanations!" She turned on her heel and walked away before he could finish.

Tilting her head back, she blinked rapidly, refusing to let the tears fall.

Watching Evelyn retreat, Nathaniel slammed his fist against the wall. A sharp pain shot through him instantly.

When Robert saw blood seeping through Nathaniel's knuckles, he paled and immediately called for a nurse to clean and bandage the wound.

But one glance at Nathaniel's expression silenced him.

Was that… helplessness flickering in the usually composed and calculating man’s eyes?

He answered without looking. "Yes?"

"Nathaniel, tomorrow’s your big day. Come home for dinner tonight. Victoria will be joining us—"

Beatrice’s words were cut off as Nathaniel ended the call abruptly. His gaze turned icy as he watched Evelyn climb into a taxi and disappear down the street.

Beatrice tried calling back several times, but Nathaniel ignored every attempt.

With an awkward smile, she turned to Victoria. "He must be swamped with work. You know how much the company relies on him."

Victoria’s smile tightened, but she kept her voice sweet. "It’s fine, Mrs. Harrington. I understand Nathaniel’s busy."

Victoria stiffened slightly. "They were, but their flight got delayed. I’ll pick them up after dinner."

"That’s not necessary, Mrs. Harrington. It’s late, and you should rest. Tomorrow will be hectic."

Victoria quickly declined. She had just lied about her brothers’ delayed flight—if Beatrice came along, her deception would be exposed.

That afternoon, Victoria tried reaching out to Alexander, hoping to arrange a dinner with her brothers and Nathaniel.

But Alexander was occupied, Sebastian said he’d arrive the next day, and Julian didn’t answer her calls.

Victoria didn’t push further. Her time with the Montgomery family had always revolved around Eleanor, and her brothers had never shown her much warmth.

She knew she was just a placeholder for the real Montgomery heiress.

So she kept her head down, biding her time—until tomorrow, when she’d finally become Mrs. Whitmore.

Once she had that title, she wouldn’t need to care about the Montgomerys’ opinions or cater to Eleanor anymore.

Dinner was just Beatrice and Victoria.

Victoria was well aware that Beatrice’s affection stemmed solely from her status as the Montgomery heiress.

Midway through the meal, her phone rang. Seeing Alexander’s name, she excused herself eagerly. "It’s Alexander!"

She answered quickly. "Alexander, are you done with work?"

"Victoria, I meant to discuss this after your engagement tomorrow, but I think you should know now." His tone was unreadable.

"I’ve sent a document to your inbox. Review it, and let me know if you have any requests."

After hanging up, Victoria opened the file.

The title was stark and unmistakable: Termination of Adoption Agreement.
###Chapter 231

A cold shiver ran down Victoria's spine as she read the words on her phone screen.

"Termination of Adoption Agreement."

What did this mean?

Victoria's fingers trembled as she struggled to process the implications.

Why would Alexander want to dissolve her adoption now?

Beatrice noticed her sudden pallor and leaned forward. "Victoria, darling, are you all right? You look like you've seen a ghost."

Victoria quickly flipped her phone face down, forcing a weak smile.

"Just a bit of nausea. Must be something I ate earlier," she lied smoothly.

There was no mistake. The legal papers clearly stated the dissolution of her adoption into the Montgomery family.

"Alexander," her voice cracked. "Have I done something wrong? Why are you abandoning me now?"

"I've been a Montgomery since I was a child. If you cast me out, where will I go? Everyone will laugh at me!"

"You're an adult now, about to marry into the Whitmore family. Your future is secure. It's time to close this chapter."

After his earlier call with Julian, Alexander had decided to break the news before tomorrow's engagement.

The unexpected complication? Evelyn herself was designing Victoria and Nathaniel's engagement ceremony.

This meant Evelyn might attend tomorrow's event—a disastrous variable Alexander couldn't risk.

With Julian and Sebastian also attending, Alexander needed to prevent any identity revelations or confrontations.

Terminating Victoria's adoption now seemed the cleanest solution.

Victoria's grip on the phone turned white-knuckled.

Alexander's resolve wavered at her distress, but thoughts of Evelyn's suffering hardened his heart.

"This isn't rejection," he said gently. "You'll always be welcome to visit."

"Then why now?" Victoria pressed. "Is this because of my marriage?"

Something didn't add up.

Her brothers' recent behavior had been... unusual.

During her stay in Bern City, Victoria had been carefully driving wedges between Nathaniel and Evelyn.

Her endgame? Their divorce—and her seamless transition into the Whitmore family.
###Chapter 232



After careful reflection, Victoria couldn't recall any missteps that might have provoked Alexander's displeasure.

What had driven him to suddenly revoke her adoption?

The thought left her reeling, struggling to piece together the logic behind it.

If the Montgomery family disowned her, she would be reduced to nothing—just another orphan.

How could she possibly secure a marriage into the prestigious Whitmore family then?

Beatrice's favor toward her was entirely contingent on the Montgomery name.

Losing that status was unthinkable. No matter what, she couldn’t let it slip through her fingers.

"Review the contract carefully. If you need anything else, let me know. I’ll do my best to accommodate you. That’s all for now."

A bitter laugh escaped her lips, laced with something darker beneath the surface.

After years of enduring Eleanor’s whims, she refused to be discarded so easily.

Her engagement to Nathaniel was nothing but a farce.

Losing her place as the Montgomery heiress was unacceptable. She would never agree to these terms.

Victoria had spent her entire life meticulously guarding her secrets.

Julian had stumbled upon the truth by accident, and ever since, his attitude toward her had shifted drastically—almost as if she were a stranger.

###Chapter 233

His protective tone betrayed his knowledge - as the only family member aware of Evelyn's pregnancy.

With a baby coming, she imagined their home growing even livelier soon.

Once everything here was settled, she planned to return to Northridge City for the delivery and raise her child there.

Noticing her exhaustion, Julian immediately stood. "It's getting late. We should all turn in."

His priority was making sure his pregnant sister got proper rest.

Evelyn knew exactly what kind of people Margaret's relatives were.

When Benjamin had his accident years ago, they'd refused to help financially. Instead, they'd advised Margaret to sell the house and divorce him.

In short, they were vultures waiting to swoop in.

"Alright, I'll safeguard it for you. Whenever you need anything, just ask." Though accepting the money, Evelyn already planned to use it for Margaret's retirement.

Did Victoria really think Evelyn had no say in these preparations?

###Chapter 234

Victoria.

###Chapter 235

###Chapter 237

Three against one—the mutual hostility was palpable.

Certainly, Nathaniel mustn't harbor feelings for Evelyn! As a divorced man entering a second marriage, he had no right to her.

Nathaniel recognized the threat in Julian's words but questioned his authority to make such demands.
###Chapter 238

Nathaniel's piercing gaze locked onto Julian. "What exactly is your relationship with Evelyn?"

A cold smirk played on Julian's lips. "That's none of your business. But mark my words - she's off limits to you. Stay away!"

The Montgomery brothers had decided confrontation was necessary. Better to lay all cards on the table now.

The air in the grand hall turned thick with tension.

Nathaniel straightened his cufflinks. "Dr. Montgomery, you overstep. Grandmother Eleanor entrusted Evelyn's care to me. Her affairs are my responsibility."

Alexander's fist clenched at the sheer audacity. Nathaniel was already engaged to Victoria! The man wanted to have his cake and eat it too?

Nathaniel's expression remained unreadable, his posture rigid with defiance.

How dare Nathaniel openly declare his intentions toward Evelyn after everything?

Julian's voice cut through like ice. "Do you honestly think you're worthy of Evelyn? I initially refused to operate on Eleanor Whitmore."

Nathaniel staggered as if struck. His voice came out raw. "Evelyn... pleaded with you?"

"Exactly." Julian's smile was razor-sharp. "Only for Evelyn's sake did I consent. Eleanor showed her kindness once - I repay debts."

Nathaniel's world tilted. His knees nearly buckled as the truth slammed into him.

All this time, he'd believed it was Victoria's influence...

Not Evelyn's silent sacrifice.

"Why..." His throat worked. "Why wouldn't she tell me?"



Julian watched Nathaniel's crumbling composure with grim satisfaction. "Perhaps she knew you'd react like this - proving once more you don't deserve her."

Nathaniel's hands trembled. "I can't make that promise."

The words hit like bullets. Nathaniel had no defense - each accusation was painfully accurate.

Slowly, he raised his eyes to the three Montgomery brothers standing united against him. The battle lines had been drawn.
###Chapter 239



Nathaniel's voice thundered through the grand hall, sharp with fury. "What the hell is that look in your eyes?"

Had he missed something crucial?

Sebastian's reaction suggested a pattern—Victoria had been manipulating the Whitmore family for far too long.

Upstairs, in the lavish dressing room, Victoria stood before the mirror, draped in a dazzling white wedding gown.



A smug smile curled her lips as she admired her reflection. The day she had waited for—the day she would finally secure her place as Mrs. Whitmore—had arrived.

In her mind, this engagement meant Evelyn no longer had a place in the Whitmore family.

Keeping her disdain hidden, Victoria smiled sweetly. "Of course. I'll introduce you after the engagement."

"Victoria, thank you—or should I call you sister now?"

Victoria's smile deepened. "By the way, Penelope, have you heard about the demolition issues in Evelyn's old neighborhood?"

"It took so much begging just to get her to let me come today."

###Chapter 240

Penelope was practically salivating at the thought of humiliating Evelyn.

All because of Evelyn Carter!

Where were Nathaniel and her brothers?

###Chapter 241

"Right away, miss."

Unbeknownst to her, Nathaniel still carried a torch for Evelyn.

Evelyn's absence as lead designer was causing professional embarrassment.

Something was wrong. Evelyn never turned off her phone.

###Chapter 242

No wonder Victoria had insisted on Evelyn designing the wedding venue from the beginning.

There had been hidden connections all along!

Should Nathaniel dare approach Evelyn again, consequences would follow.

###Chapter 243

Victoria couldn't fathom why Nathaniel had abandoned her. Now even her brothers were turning their backs on her.

They were supposed to be her family. On the most important day of her life, what could possibly matter more than her?

Nathaniel's absence was bad enough, but having her brothers stay might have salvaged some dignity from this disaster.

Now? She'd be the laughingstock of high society.

With Evelyn absent today, that particular Pandora's box would remain closed.

Alexander checked his phone, his expression darkening. "We need to leave."

Olivia's message had come through. Their surveillance team had located Evelyn.

Every second counted now.

"Company emergency," Alexander lied smoothly.

As her brothers walked away, a cold dread settled in Victoria's chest.

This was supposed to be her day. Why was everyone abandoning her?

The contract Alexander had given her earlier burned in her mind. They thought they could discard her so easily?

After years as the Montgomery heiress, she wouldn't be cast aside.

She'd fight tooth and nail to keep her position.

Penelope's voice broke through her thoughts. "Victoria, why did your brothers leave?"

###Chapter 244

###Chapter 245

###Chapter 246

###Chapter 247

###Chapter 248
